name: battery

battery noun
(ELECTRICAL DEVICE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A2 [ C ] a device that produces electricity to provide power for electronic devices, cars, etc.: a rechargeable battery This alarm clock takes two medium-sized batteries. My phone's battery is about to die (= to run out of power). I got back to the car to find that the battery was flat (= had lost all its power). a battery-operated hairdryer See also
battery life

battery noun
(IN BASEBALL)
[ C ] In a baseball team, the pitcher (= the player who throws the ball) and the catcher (= the player who catches balls that are not hit) are sometimes referred to as the battery: Paige and Gibson combined to form the greatest battery in baseball history. A catcher needs to develop a good rapport with his battery mate.
